metadata.title: CVE-2018-5683 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The vga_draw_text function in Qemu allows local OS guest privileged usersto cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and QEMU process crash) byleveraging improper memory address validation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5683` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-data - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-gui - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu2').
